result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge during the period of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending a review on 4/8/2016 at 1:15 pm in Branch 38.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Wayne Shaw

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw in court.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 


The court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 months in the House of Correction. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 20 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4/8/2016 at 1:15 pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment as able.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge during the period of probation. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.

Court advises defendant of 20 day appeal period.  

RECEIVED & FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

State was prepared to proceed to trial today. No appearance by Angele Dentice. Repeated attempts to contact counsel made by clerk. Court orders counsel removed as counsel of record and will allow defendant to proceed pro se. Colloquy between court and defendant as to WAIVER of counsel.


Defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw in court with Attorney Robert Hampton as a friend of the court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Review hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant now wants new counsel.  The court will not adjourn on trial date for new counsel.  Offer placed on the record and rejected by defendant.  The court will adjourn trial date as there is an in-custody case that is proceeding.  The state was prepared to proceed to trial today.   The court will no longer accept any plea bargains or negotiations.  If case is to resolve short of trial it must be brought in to the court at least ONE WEEK PRIOR to the scheduled date.  Case is adjourned to 1-13-2016 for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Offer is rejected by defendant.  All discovery received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 38 on 10-28-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued, until further order of the Court.   mld

Attorney Angele R. Dentice in court, Defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw not in court, in custody.  Kristin Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Evan K Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Copy of certified record was filed by the State.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Additional discovery, 911 tape will need to be forwarded to defense counsel, per the State.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

15RM012051  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/07/15
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Valerie J.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Shaw in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  OCCR Tape#15-046
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 04 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
